.class public auto ansi beforefieldinit DecimalFormatSymbols extends Java.Lang.Object implements class Android.Runtime.IJavaObject, class Java.Interop.IJavaPeerable, class Java.IO.ISerializable, class Java.Lang.ICloneable, class System.IDisposable
type DecimalFormatSymbols = class inherit Object interface ISerializable interface IJavaObject interface IDisposable interface IJavaPeerable interface ICloneable
public class DecimalFormatSymbols : Java.Lang.Object, IDisposable, Java.IO.ISerializable, Java.Lang.ICloneable

Docs.summary: [icu enhancement] ICU's replacement for java.text.DecimalFormatSymbols.

remarks.para: [icu enhancement] ICU's replacement for java.text.DecimalFormatSymbols. Methods, fields, and other functionality specific to ICU are labeled '[icu]'. This class represents the set of symbols (such as the decimal separator, the grouping separator, and so on) needed by DecimalFormat to format numbers. DecimalFormat creates for itself an instance of DecimalFormatSymbols from its locale data. If you need to change any of these symbols, you can get the DecimalFormatSymbols object from your DecimalFormat and modify it.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Android.Icu.Util.Currency? Currency { get; set; }
.property instance class Android.Icu.Util.Currency Currency
member this.Currency : Android.Icu.Util.Currency with get, set

Docs.param: the new currency to be used
Docs.summary: Returns the currency symbol, for DecimalFormatSymbols#getCurrency() API compatibility only. -or- Sets the currency.

remarks.para: Property getter documentation:
Returns the currency symbol, for DecimalFormatSymbols#getCurrency() API compatibility only. ICU clients should use the Currency API directly.
Property setter documentation:
Sets the currency.
Note: ICU does not use the DecimalFormatSymbols for the currency any more. This API is present for API compatibility only.
This also sets the currency symbol attribute to the currency's symbol in the DecimalFormatSymbols' locale, and the international currency symbol attribute to the currency's ISO 4217 currency code.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: [icu] Returns the string used to separate the mantissa from the exponent. -or- [icu] Sets the string used to separate the mantissa from the exponent.

remarks.para: Property getter documentation:
[icu] Returns the string used to separate the mantissa from the exponent. Examples: "x10^" for 1.23x10^4, "E" for 1.23E4.
Property setter documentation:
[icu] Sets the string used to separate the mantissa from the exponent. Examples: "x10^" for 1.23x10^4, "E" for 1.23E4.

MemberSignature.Value: public static Android.Icu.Text.DecimalFormatSymbols? ForNumberingSystem (Android.Icu.Util.ULocale? locale, Android.Icu.Text.NumberingSystem? ns);
.method public static hidebysig class Android.Icu.Text.DecimalFormatSymbols ForNumberingSystem(class Android.Icu.Util.ULocale locale, class Android.Icu.Text.NumberingSystem ns) cil managed
static member ForNumberingSystem : Android.Icu.Util.ULocale * Android.Icu.Text.NumberingSystem -> Android.Icu.Text.DecimalFormatSymbols

Docs.summary: [icu] Returns a DecimalFormatSymbols instance for the given locale with digits and symbols corresponding to the given NumberingSystem.

remarks.para: [icu] Returns a DecimalFormatSymbols instance for the given locale with digits and symbols corresponding to the given NumberingSystem.
This method behaves equivalently to #getInstance called with a locale having a "numbers=xxxx" keyword specifying the numbering system by name.
In this method, the NumberingSystem argument will be used even if the locale has its own "numbers=xxxx" keyword.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

.method public static hidebysig class Java.Util.Locale[] GetAvailableLocales() cil managed
static member GetAvailableLocales : unit -> Java.Util.Locale[]

Docs.summary: Returns an array of all locales for which the getInstance methods of this class can return localized instances.
Docs.returns: An array of Locales for which localized DecimalFormatSymbols instances are available.

remarks.para: Returns an array of all locales for which the getInstance methods of this class can return localized instances.

Note: Unlike java.text.DecimalFormatSymbols#getAvailableLocales, this method simply returns the array of Locales available for this class. ICU currently does not support DecimalFormatSymbolsProvider, which was introduced in Java 6.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual string? GetPatternForCurrencySpacing (Android.Icu.Text.CurrencySpacing itemType, bool beforeCurrency);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance string GetPatternForCurrencySpacing(valuetype Android.Icu.Text.CurrencySpacing itemType, bool beforeCurrency) cil managed
abstract member GetPatternForCurrencySpacing : Android.Icu.Text.CurrencySpacing * bool -> string override this.GetPatternForCurrencySpacing : Android.Icu.Text.CurrencySpacing * bool -> string

Docs.param: one of CURRENCY_SPC_CURRENCY_MATCH, CURRENCY_SPC_SURROUNDING_MATCH or CURRENCY_SPC_INSERT
true to get the beforeCurrency values, false to get the afterCurrency values.
Docs.summary: [icu] Returns the desired currency spacing value.

remarks.para: [icu] Returns the desired currency spacing value. Original values come from ICU's CLDR data based on the locale provided during construction, and can be null. These values govern what and when text is inserted between a currency code/name/symbol and the currency amount when formatting money.
For more information, see UTS#35 section 5.10.2.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual char PadEscape { get; set; }
.property instance char PadEscape
member this.PadEscape : char with get, set

Docs.summary: [icu] Returns the character used to pad numbers out to a specified width. -or- [icu] Sets the character used to pad numbers out to a specified width.

remarks.para: Property getter documentation:

[icu] Returns the character used to pad numbers out to a specified width. This is not the pad character itself; rather, it is the special pattern character preceding the pad character. In the pattern "*_#,##0", '*' is the pad escape, and '_' is the pad character.
Property setter documentation:

[icu] Sets the character used to pad numbers out to a specified width. This is not the pad character itself; rather, it is the special pattern character preceding the pad character. In the pattern "*_#,##0", '*' is the pad escape, and '_' is the pad character.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void SetDigitStrings (string[]? digitStrings);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetDigitStrings(string[] digitStrings) cil managed
abstract member SetDigitStrings : string[] -> unit override this.SetDigitStrings : string[] -> unit

Docs.param: The array of digit strings. The length of the array must be exactly 10.
Docs.summary: [icu] Sets the array of strings used as digits, in order from 0 through 9

remarks.para: [icu] Sets the array of strings used as digits, in order from 0 through 9
Note:

When the input array of digit strings contains any strings represented by multiple Java chars, then #getDigits() will return the default digits ('0' - '9') and #getZeroDigit() will return the default zero digit ('0').
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void SetPatternForCurrencySpacing (Android.Icu.Text.CurrencySpacing itemType, bool beforeCurrency, string? pattern);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetPatternForCurrencySpacing(valuetype Android.Icu.Text.CurrencySpacing itemType, bool beforeCurrency, string pattern) cil managed

abstract member SetPatternForCurrencySpacing : Android.Icu.Text.CurrencySpacing * bool * string -> unit override this.SetPatternForCurrencySpacing : Android.Icu.Text.CurrencySpacing * bool * string -> unit

Docs.param: one of CURRENCY_SPC_CURRENCY_MATCH, CURRENCY_SPC_SURROUNDING_MATCH or CURRENCY_SPC_INSERT
true if the pattern is for before the currency symbol. false if the pattern is for after it.
string to override current setting; can be null.
Docs.summary: [icu] Sets the indicated currency spacing pattern or value.

remarks.para: [icu] Sets the indicated currency spacing pattern or value. See #getPatternForCurrencySpacing for more information.
Values for currency match and surrounding match must be android.icu.text.UnicodeSet patterns. Values for insert can be any string.
Note: ICU4J does not currently use this information.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.
